intro: Guatteria podocarpa var. oligocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen fig, is a tropical plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to figs, though they are not related to true figs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
